memo:
BILL NUMBER:S99

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:

Excludes a social security number or social security card from
documentation required to be provided to renew an existing driver's
license.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:

Section 1 Amends Section 502 (6) (a) of the Vehicle and Traffic Law.
Provides that an applicant for renewal of a driver's license shall not
be required to provide his or her social security number or show a
social security card even if such number or card was not provided to
the Department in a previous transaction.

Section 2 Effective Date

JUSTIFICATION:

To reduce the constant worry of having to provide a social security
card and or information when renewing a driver's license as well as
making the process a lot easier and faster.

PRIOR LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:

2009-2010 S.2179 - Referred to Transportation/A.329 - Referred to
Transportation; Enacting Clause Stricken

2007-2008 A.1729 - Referred to Transportation

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:

To be determined

EFFECTIVE DATE:

This act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall become
a law.
